website_summaries.verdict: A simpler version of other Teva styles.
pros: Choice of black, deep teal, bungee cord, North Atlantic, purple orchid, suri black multi and suri taupe multi (Zappos and Amazon)

Amazon also offers Bering Sea, blanket red stripes red, grenadine, royal blue, Tzuna purple, modern stripes purple, black-white, lake blue, pink, blanket stripes grey, modern stripes blue and deep teal
Webbing upper, hook-and-loop closure, nylon shank, contoured EVA midsole, cushioned antimicrobial Microban footbed, shock absorbing heel, spider original rubber outsole
cons: Ankle straps too small on larger sizes

customer_reviews.title: Love these hiking sandals!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 7.5-8 shoe, I ordered an 8 to be safe, there's a little room at the toes but that's good for protecting toe stubs :) I know you're thinking they're white and they'll get so dirty but they clean easily with just water, I live in Florida and I'm out in my yard working with these on and they'll get filthy but unjust run the hose over them and they're clean again! They're super comfy, Teva usually is. Can't go wrong with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Goddess Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are soooo comfortable. Wore them for the first time all day at a waterpark. They felt good on my feet all day....no blisters! Super cushiony and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Love my Tevas!
customer_reviews.text: I wore them for the first time on an 8 mile hike. I was confident they would be comfortable and they WERE WONDERFUL! I will always buy Tevas...they fit my feet really well and give me the arch support I need for sandals. I've learned over the years how to buy the right size for me in Tevas...in closed shoes I wear a 10.5 wide. Yep my feet are monsters. Well in the Tevas I wear a 9.5! So I must find styles that come in half sizes (since not all Tevas do).
customer_reviews.author: MommaJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable with good cushioning and arch support. They are more sleek and stylish than Teva Tirra (which I also have), though Tirra's extra straps make it more supportive and its thicker sole provides a little more cushioning. The velcro straps are great, as non-adjustable sandals are always too wide for me (I'm on the slim side of M), and the length is good in my normal size 8. Drizzle is a nice neutral color.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Best all day shoe I have!
customer_reviews.text: These were great. Had a 16 hour flight, lots of walking in between, and lots of walking at my destination. Not one time did my feet feel swollen, sore or tired because of these shoes. Great on the soles of the feet, uppers and support. Definitely worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: unixchik

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like but Tirra and Numa are so much better!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these because of the thin feminine straps and the color. However being a teva fan I know what is out there and had to return them. Comparing them to my teva tirras (best arch support) and my teva numas (second best arch support) I thought these were pretty flat support wise. I did not like that the straps were only partially padded on the side facing my foot so the the raw strap material was exposed and less comfy. Where the straps attached to the shoe bed they seemed to be coming apart upon arrival. The quality of these was less than I expect from teva.
customer_reviews.author: Sassifrass

customer_reviews.title: Weird tight small fit!
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed that these could not fit. The Velcro ankle strap is so short, it could never be comfortable. What's the point of having Velcro straps if you don't make them adjustable for a wide range of people. I have arthritis in one ankle from a car accident, so I can't wear the strap tight on that leg. These were really cute, and I had a pair of Teva before and loved them, so it was a big disappointment to have to send these back.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Just sad...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the way this sandal looked & was excited to try it, but when I tried it I immediately missed what I liked about a previous Teva sandal I'd purchased awhile back & that was that it had a more cushioned foot bed & better arch support...This one is lighter & much thinner than the "TIRRA" model & it just didn't give me the comfort & support that my other sandal did, so unfortunately I sent it back. But I did keep the 2nd pair of Tirra's :) I also like that they have velcro closures so when my feet swell it's easy to just loosen them.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... with plantar's fasciitis knows the struggle of finding a good shoe. I have an extremely high arch in ...
customer_reviews.text: Someone living with plantar's fasciitis knows the struggle of finding a good shoe. I have an extremely high arch in my foot and have a difficult time finding shoes that support my arch. This show is cushiony and conforms to my foot. I've worn these shoes literally all day apart from bed since I bought them around a month ago and my feet have stopped hurting. I'm in love.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: FLUFFY CLOUDS
customer_reviews.text: After reading lots of reviews, I ordered these shoes for a trip to Disney. I'll tell you now that these shoes are so comfortable!!! I tried them on in a store before buying them online and fit into an 8 even though I'm an 8.5. I recommend either trying on in store or getting a half size down. They feel like fluffy clouds!
customer_reviews.author: cmt

customer_reviews.title: Initially comfy, but they do cause wounds and blisters
customer_reviews.text: I agree with what the other reviews mention about these sandals being comfy, however, don’t let this initial feeling of comfort deceive you: I wore them for a half hour walk within my neighborhood (i.e. flat, paved paths and I was not walking fast) and they destroyed my feet - like, I got wounds [broken skin] at the back of my feet (right above the heel) and my pinkie toes as well as blisters on the soles of my feet. So I would recommend wearing some sort of protection (eg. band-aids) on sensitive areas until the sandals really adapt well to your feet. Also, the sandals were not tight at all, so it was not a size problem.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet with high arches
customer_reviews.text: Being a Plus Size woman with high arches and wide feet, they did not fit. The strap that goes across the top of the foot was too short to fasten well and be comfortable and the straps across the toes were too tight.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Painful...
customer_reviews.text: COMPLETELY UNCOMFORTABLE. If you plan on doing any walking skip these. There is zero padding, hard sole. A pair of 99cent flip flops will do less damage to your poor unsuspecting foot. I wish I had paid better attention to photos posted like this one. If you value your small toe... do not make this purchase. The design of the shoe is quite poor. And there is no padding under the straps. Only way I would keep these... you are going on a long car ride and just need something to get you in and out of the rest stop restroom. Crocs sandals have far better designed and far more comfortable shoes and a better price point.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, these are some of the most comfortable sandals I've ever purchased. I am a 7.5 and none of the other high end sandals come in half sizes. I NEED a half size, regardless of what the retailers try to tell me. I've had these for five days and have been wearing them constantly. Dog walking, cooking, cleaning, even hiking and they are perfect!!! Bought a second style and will write the exact same review for them. Thanks, Teva!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Lynn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh these babies are super comfortable!!! I got it at a really good price too! Soooo happy!!!! Side note This next message is for my Black people: I’m black so I can say this-> listen my people, these shoes are hella comfy and they actually look good on my feet! I’m a young adult and I plan on traveling and doing a lot of walking soon and I highly recommend these shoes or something similar. I promise you will see why a lot of non Melanin people wear them! They feet be comfy AF!! So don’t be afraid to rock these bad boys at the bbq! Oh and they are water friendly too!
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: best sandals ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these sandals. I online ordered 20 pairs of sandals to find these, and these were the winners. I wear a 10N in a sandal so I'm a very difficult fit and I have low foot bulk to boot. Most sandals can't be tightened enough to work for me, or after being tightened, the straps are all weird. These are just right. I was worried the arch support would be insufficient but I'm pretty impressed. I also have plantar fasciitis and these have been fine. I feel like they are very cute and low profile too. I've worn them with shorts, dressier pants, and even a sun dress.
customer_reviews.author: MinnieMouse

customer_reviews.title: A little wide but adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these but was worried about the width. I have narrow feet so it was a concern. I loved the color so I took the chance. When I received them I loved the color and style. I put them on and to my surprise I was able to adjust them to a comfortable width. Yes, they were a bit wide but the Velcro really helped. I love the roomy foot bed across the top so my toes aren’t squished together. I may order these in a different color if they feel good on as I wear them. Four stars because of the width only! But I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Eskoite323

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Teva Verra sandals. They are incredibly versatile -- I've worn them for teaching, walks, kayaking, biking, etc. They look nice, and they are very comfortable. After awhile, I found my first pair to be a bit long, so I donated them to a friend who still wears them. (Buy a half-size smaller than you actually wear.) My second pair just wore out on a rough, muddy hike. I was sad that I couldn't buy the exact same color, but tried the ones with the ugly name - bungee cord. They are actually quite an attractive beige/taupe color. I'm sure that these will serve me for the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Debra.teacher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoes for in and out of water
customer_reviews.text: Seriously great shoes. I had keens in the past and they gave me horrible blisters so I decided to give these a shot based on their reviews. I wore them all around havasu falls in Arizona. They saved my feet during the trip! They fit very true to size and the straps never bothered me. I love them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Blistered and bummed
customer_reviews.text: I am a lover of all things Teva but these fell short. I purchased them for a 2 week vacation and the first time I wore them I got a very painful blister. This has never ever happened before with any Tevas I have owned. They are the cutest thing ever, but not the most comfortable. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Duquet

customer_reviews.title: Toe strap a bit annoying. Worth owning.
customer_reviews.text: I have only the owned Teva Terras. My dog kept eating them, so went through 3 pairs. Decided to try this kind. I honestly like and prefer the Terras BY FAR. I took one star off for the toe strap being a tad uncomfortable. Terra's are 11 out of 10 in my book. These are ok. I definitely want my Terras again still after having these. I did go down a half size. I fluctuate between 6 for open toes heels, 6.5 for most things and 7 for boots or flat footed attire. I ordered a 6.5 and it's perfect. I also have narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Sandle Completely Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I have long admired this sandal in a popular travel magazine, available only in black or taupe. The perfect travel sandal, it is stylish enough for in town (Sienna, Santa Fe) and rugged enough for moderate day hiking ( Cinque Terra, Catalina). When I saw this color at ridiculous clearance price, I couldn't hold out any longer! I actually like that the toe strap is a tastefull coordinating woven pastel. The velcro design of the toe straps and the ankle straps makes them fully adjustable--important for in between sizes, swelling vacation feet. These replace a pair from another brand that was NOT adjustable enough.
customer_reviews.author: That Wiley Woman

customer_reviews.title: Straps will not hold foot secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for this year's 3-week winter trip to the beach in Florida. I have previously worn Teva sandals with no problems. However, this model created real problems. I noticed the first day out, walking and shelling on the beach, that my feet kept sliding under the straps at the front of the shoe. Tried to tighten the strap but was unable to stop the sliding. Long story short, I returned home with very hurtful sores on both feet... at the same places on each foot... all under the front straps. I am very disappointed that now I have to replace these rather expensive sandals after one vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and durable. If you’re between sizes, go smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I have very flat feet and I wear these everywhere, from city sidewalks to mountain creeks. They’re my most comfortable shoe. My feet never hurt. Even though they’re a little too wide for my AA size 10’s, I love them. (I bought these in a 9.5, and they fit well.) I’ve had them for about 1.5 years now, and wear them all summer and spring. 2 seasons of camping, hiking and fishing so far, and no seams or stitches unraveling. Traction is still great and footbed is still supportive.
customer_reviews.author: SF Native

customer_reviews.title: Great Footbed, but for Thin Ankles
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 6.5/7 shoe. I do agree with the other reviews that if you're between sizes, go with the size down. The 6.5 was great. The footbed is incredibly comfortable. I ordered these to wear to Disney in August. Unfortunately the strap around the ankle is so short that in order to secure it, well I have to pull it tight, which means this is a no go. I just barely was able to secure it. I do have larger ankles because of multiple sprains during my soccer days, but they are not abnormally large. If you have small ankles, these are great, otherwise, go for something without the ankle strap.
customer_reviews.author: RLhiva

customer_reviews.title: We really wanted to love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2pairs for myself and my daughter. (Black pairs and purple pairs). The shoes were lovely and the foot bed was true to size BUT the strap across the top of our instep was too short. It fastened but was tight and uncomfortable on me and my daughter, who has a high instep, couldn't even fasten hers. We sent them all back and were heartbroken that we didn't have them for our vacation.
customer_reviews.author: BFH

customer_reviews.title: Used shoes?!  Seriously?!
customer_reviews.text: Received these Teva sandals today in a crushed shoe box that was shipped in a plastic Amazon bag. The “shapers” were not in the Sandals but we’re in top of then in the box. It was my first clue that these shoes were not new. Sure enough. Dirty soles with gravel in the treads. Yuck! As for the sandals in general, the soles are very hard plastic and did not appear comfortable. I did not even try them on because I was grossed out. I’m not paying this price for used shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Karen H

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these at all cost
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how poorly these are made. I have had them for one month and the straps are already pulling apart from the sole. These sandals are literally falling apart after ONE month. I would give them zero stars if I could. It seems that returns for these are not allowed, so I am out $70 for shoes that lasted me a month. They are also sized a half size off from normal sizing. The arches are structured poorly. The straps are poorly stitched so the loose strands rub your feet and cause blisters. I have never been more disappointed in a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Donatelli

customer_reviews.title: sooo comfortable, all day long for months
customer_reviews.text: I live in these sandals for months. They are so comfortable, all day long. They run a little big, and I bought a 7, although in most shoes I typically wear a 7-1/2. I like that they have velcro for adjusting the straps; however, I think I usually keep them at the exact same setting. I like the option of being able to change the tightness however, just in case my feet swell a little. The neutral color is very attractive. There is some arch in these sandals, so they are not totally non-supportive. I needed to buy another pair of these, since my first pair wore out. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Never Too Old To LearnTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, comfortable, and secure
customer_reviews.text: I love my Tevas. I was looking for a casual sandal that could be worn with shorts or with a summery dress, and these sandals nailed it! They are very comfortable and my feet feel secure, but they aren’t bulky which makes them easy to dress up or down. Update - the soles of these shoes do not breathe. My feet create quite the unpleasant odor after wearing for longer period of time. Still no blisters.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeMyAmazonPerfectlyPrime

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals. I walk 4 miles a day and they're very comfortable. At first I had some foot/calf pain but it went away after about three days of wear. Like others have said, your foot does sit pretty far back in the shoe. This has caused me to trip a few times. I can see the material getting scraped up at the to of the shoe where I keep tripping and I am a little worried about their durability. They don't look too rugged for every day use, though I'd like it if all of the straps were black instead of the top two being mixed.
customer_reviews.author: Mirror Coat

customer_reviews.title: TEVA SANDALS PAINTED
customer_reviews.text: This suppose to be TEVA and I think this are fake, fit was good and comfortable the only thing is that inside sole are painted and paint is coming out since the first day I wear it, it looks like old sandal, I don't want to wear it like that any more
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought size 7.5 (my usual fit) and they fit as I would expect. I bought these specifically for walking around an amusement park/water park all summer. These Teva's are amazing! The arch support has been phenomenal and has reduced my leg fatigue from walking in flip flops. The footbed has the perfect balance between cushion and firm. These Teva's quickly became my daily summer shoes! Negatives: I wish I could tighten the front foot strap better When the shoes get wet, my foot feels very loose in the sandal and slide all over
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever but rough on skin
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is well constructed but the material is a little rough, rubbing blisters on my bare feet near the pinky toe. No amount of adjusting is stopping the friction. If the cord material were a little softer it would be better. I do like the way it snugs up nicely around the heal. I seem to be in-between sizes so am struggling to find a sandal that fits perfectly. I ordered this one because it has some many ways to adjust it. The color also goes with anything.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Brinkley, author of BONFYRE

customer_reviews.title: Great walking sandals
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order shoes from online. I never know how they'll fit or the quality of the shoe. I'm very glad I did. I wore these this past weekend for the first time on an all day walking adventure with my kids. They felt great. Comfortable, adjustable, perfect size fit. I walked all day in them and didn't have any of the rubbing that you would expect with completely unbroken in shoes. I got these to walk at work, and I know now I made the right choice. I will definitely buy from this brand again when these eventually wear out.
customer_reviews.author: xstarfirex08

customer_reviews.title: It fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other customer comments about the size being large, I did not find that to be the case. I tried on the same sandal at a brick and mortar store to know whether the shoe would work. It fit like a glove. But when these sandals came, they were not like the ones at the store. Everyone is right about the length of the velcro straps. The most important one is too short. I thought about keeping them and maybe adding some velcro to make sure they would stay together. But there is no way to match the blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond of De Nial

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Ok - I LOVE these. Purchased the black/multi, size 9.5. As soon as I took them out of the box a week ago, they are all I've worn. I was recently diagnosed with tendinitis in my foot and needed something supportive, comfortable and that was cute. These fit the bill perfectly. No foot pain/swelling! I will be buying more! I took off a star because the heel strap where it attaches to the sole is separating already. Kind of disappointing after a week - BUT they still work just fine. Could be just a quirk? They are still firmly attached under/through the sole so it probably won't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy W

customer_reviews.title: Nice sandal just not for my purposr
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly just want what I had hoped. This is a cushy version of Teva for casual walking, the urban warrior, or an after hike shoe. Not a sturdy hiking sandals, not a sturdy enough sole, not enough support for putting on some rough all terrain miles. Nice padded heel strap, nice adjustability in the straps. More sleek, could when wear as a dressier sandal if desired. Just not sturdy and supportive for my hiking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Fussy

customer_reviews.title: Something doesn’t feel right
customer_reviews.text: Have had several pairs of Tevas over the years and this one is different. Love the color but it does not feel as sturdy as prior Sandles and have an on-going problem with one of the straps which does not want to go through the plastic to put it on. Fit is as expected. This Sandle just does not get the 5 star rating all my previous ones have. Disappointed. UPDATE: realized these look similar to the Teva Tierra they are a different model and different price point. I will stick with the sturdier, pricier model as I wear Tevas. on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: chicagotoots

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They're perfect for when I'm out running errands or even walking the dog when it's a thousand degrees outside. I used to wear cheapie flip flops and sandals, but my feet would get so sore after a few hours. These are comfortable and my feet don't get tired wearing, waking and standing in them all day. They make it easy to play in the backyard with a sprinkler on for the kiddo and dog, and I just don't have to worry much about them. Do your feet a favor and get these.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nieman

customer_reviews.title: Problems...
customer_reviews.text: Because of the narrow straps (I got a silvery-gray pair), these look dressier than one would expect for a pair of Tevas. And they are comfortable.... EXCEPT, I have rather large ankles, and there isn't quite enough Velcro to close them firmly. Really??? The mfr. couldn't add another 1/2 inch of velcro? Also, one of them squeaks when I walk, and that is a deal-breaker for me. I can't stand squeaky shoes [actually, it's more like a fart sound...what woman wants that sound while she's walking?!]. The upper and the sole seem to be attached together securely on that sandal; so it's not just a loose piece that I can glue together. Darn it, I was hoping to love these.
customer_reviews.author: A student of history

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sandals
customer_reviews.text: I liked these so much, that I immediately bought another pair in another color. I sized up a half size, not because the shoe was wrong, but because I should have done that with the first pair. My big toe hangs a bit over the end of the left shoe and because I had surgery on my right foot recently, my right foot is a little larger. The ability to adjust the straps at the toe, means that I get a perfect fit quite easily. Very comfortable to walk in and I've worn them all day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Corr

customer_reviews.title: One Small Flaw
customer_reviews.text: These are very high quality and I love everything about except for one of the very things I bought then for: the footbed. I thought that Tevas would be great because you could scrub them now and then, which you can. But the rubber of this particular footbed is not rough enough to let air pass really at all--so I end up rocking my inner dork by wearing them with socks. (!) Which was not the intention.
customer_reviews.author: Neptis

customer_reviews.title: The most comfy sandals I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a recent trip and I usually don’t do well with shoes that wrap around the backs of my feet because my feet are wide and they end up rubbing somewhere. The ability to adjust these in two locations really was handy and these were super comfortable to walk in all day. We walked on cobblestones, hiked across a river and then over very uneven trails and over rocks. I even swam with these on because the ocean floor was really rocky. I can’t recommend them enough. I am ordering two more pairs in other colors to have on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Leedesign

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed quality wasn't consistent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I have a pair similar, same brand I bought for a Rome trip that I absolutely love. My disappoint is the Velcro strap as in pics. The none velro portion is too short so they are hard to get on, catch on ring. Once on it doesn't cover the remainder of the Velcro, so threads and thring catch on exposed strap. I have added a pic of my first pair that I love. They are too expensive to lack attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaCookie

customer_reviews.title: Preferred over chacos!
customer_reviews.text: I have chacos and while they serve their purpose, they are heavy (even the lighter styles) and I find the soles uncomfortable after extended wear. I have been searching for a replacement and these are the ones! The sole and overall fit is much more comfortable. They are very light. The straps around the heel and ankle are really comfortable and provide great/snug support and help the sandal stay in place for more rugged terrain. I also like that they are more feminine and cute than chacos or original tevas. I’m hoping the Velcro holds up over time but I am so happy with these! True to size.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Teva's, both similar. I find them very comfortable, adjustable, and durable. This style looks nice with dresses or casual. I like being able to walk in water without it hurting the shoe. The only complaint I have is when I walk on natural paths, small weed debris seems to kick up inside the shoe and I have to stop and shake them out. I can't figure any way to avoid that. So I can't really recommend them for hiking, for this reason mainly. I mainly bought my second pair because puppies chewed on the straps of the first and they don't look as nice as they had. :)
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but .5 size big
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy sandal. Great adjustability. I have narrow feet so I was happy that these have an adjustable strap across the toes. Foot bed is squishy. They seem a little long. I am between an 8 8.5. I ordered the 8.5 and I wish I would have gotten the 8 but I was leaving for a trip and didn’t have time to wait for an exchange. It didn’t keep me from wearing them but I think I would have liked the 8 better because these felt closer to 8.5/9. Overall, nice sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best sandals for walking and look great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an upcoming cruise I had. I wanted something that would be comfortable for walking two to three miles a day and double as a dress sandal. These were the perfect pair. Wore them prior to my vacation to break them in, but they really didn't need it. I am so happy I purchased these. They are easy to clean too. The dry fast after getting them wet in water. Fit perfectly. I wear a size seven and bought the same size. They are true to size.
customer_reviews.author: TammieK

customer_reviews.title: These Teva's didn't work for me.  :(
customer_reviews.text: These Teva Verra Sandal's were uncomfortable in a couple ways. One, they ran a little big and I could NOT adjust them enough, to fit. I had to adjust the velcro as far as it would go and then it left a flippy strap, to the out-side of my toes. The 2nd thing, was that the arch support was too much. it pushed up on both of my feet and actually made my feet hurt immediately. I don't like writing bad reviews. I really hoped these Teva's would work. They're cute!
customer_reviews.author: kathyjfla

customer_reviews.title: Not good for the beach
customer_reviews.text: Although they are very cute, the open toed design is not good for the beach. The open toe allows all the sand to get inside the shoe and under your feet. This inhibits walking and gets sand everywhere. The sole is quite inflexible and does not bend around rocks or hazards which is a potential falling hazard. I felt that they ran large and too much of the front of the sandal open.
customer_reviews.author: Leafpeeper

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment. Not enough velcro for adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that there was so little velcro available for adjusting these sandals. The footbeds can work for a wide of foot widths if there was velcro that extended along the length of the strap. Cost cutting by this manufacturer to reduce the amount of velcro on these sandals is a bad move. These are expensive sandals, too expensive to get cheap about the amount of velcro. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Dulcinea El Toboso

customer_reviews.title: Ankle strap can be a bit tight if you don't size up, sole doesn't hold up too long but is as expected for a women's shoe
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are ok. They don't hold up nearly as long as the men's version (mine lasted 2 years, my husbands lasted 4 years). The first time I purchased these I got them at a DSW, they were out of 11s so I got a 10 because that is my typical shoe size. This time I ordered the 11. The sole of the shoe definitely feels and looks a bit long because I sized up, but the size 10 strap was really hard to keep closed because the ankle opening was so small. The ankle strap on the 11s is perfect. My only hope for the future is a sole that will hold up for longer.
customer_reviews.author: mathluv3r

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!!! Happy Feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how my feet have waited this long to find the comfort of these amazing sandals! Great for long walks, some hiking (I would not do steep). So beyond comfortable, straps are perfect. Cannot say enough amazing things about them. Had my friend buy them too and she cannot stop raving about them either. Don't hesitate, buy them, your feet will be so happy! True to size
customer_reviews.author: palmtree4ever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a full day of walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals to use on a trip to Spain. I was not sure that I would wear them because sandals aren't the most comfortable shoes to be doing a full day of walking in, but the reviews said they were comfortable. I wore them the first day I was there to test them out, and I ended up wearing them everyday of the trip. For around 2 weeks I wore the shoes for practically 12 hours a day and walked an average of 8-15 miles a day. These shoes are very comfortable. My feet which typically hurt after standing all day didn't hurt at all during the trip. You will not be disappointed in these!
customer_reviews.author: Maddi Janelle Galusha

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed...😳
customer_reviews.text: I already have this shoe but in a different color, bought these to have more color options to match with outfits. The pair I ordered from Shoe Carnival are much nicer than the pair I ordered from Amazon. Not sure if they are knock offs or what the deal is. The soles are much flimsier, the arch support isn't as high, the velcro at the toe leaves blisters. I just wasn't impressed at all with the quality and returned them. I love Tevas so I had high hopes when ordering these but ended up being disappointed. I do not recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Close but no cigar...
customer_reviews.text: Friends recommended Teva and after trying a different style Teva in the store I ordered these as they looked better. They arrived today and while they are the proper length and are wonderfully cushy, they were too wide. I tightened them as much as I could and it still rubbed, (right off the arch before the ball of the foot), when I walked. I ordered the pair I tried on to replace this pair. So, sticking with Teva. I don't find the other style visually appealing but they should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sandals for Bunions!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are INCREDIBLY comfortable. I walked in them all day with no pain/blisters. I have bad bunions with collapsing arches, and it is very hard to find sandals that provide this much support and comfort without rubbing. The triangular cut allows space for my bunions to breathe.They also look cute with Capris and cropped pants and can be adjusted for a secure fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tills

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Supports by High Arches
customer_reviews.text: Love these sandals, only ones I can walk around Walt Disney World the whole day, even with though I have Plantar Fasciitis. These lifesavers as any of my other shoes would kill my feet after walking only a short distance. I bought another pair, if these wear out. Especially since so many companies seem to be sold to other companies and they change the design and styles, and are never the same as the originals.
customer_reviews.author: D. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Cute, comfy sandals, don’t wear well
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals, very cute and comfortable, I got the berry red ones in a 9.5. The only issue for me is where the strap adjustment plastic bit is placed over the small toe, it rubs my right pinky toe. The left is fine. I have a wide foot and narrow heel and usually can only wear Birkenstock’s 40 R, or Chaco’s 8 W (when they were still made with pride in USA). And they Velcro on the straps is grey, would’ve been better in the same color. Update after months of wear did not hold up strap came away from sole, light grey footbed gets dirty & is unattractive. Had to throw out. Will go back to Birks.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sandals - comfy and stylish! This is my second pair of Teva sandals - and the second time I am thrilled by the comfort, quality, and exterior. I used them for a light hiking in Costa Rica - and they definitely passed the test (light, water-resistant, good sole). One of the coolest features is having regulated strips to adjust shoes on a foot.
customer_reviews.author: Iger Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 7.5, but I've noticed that my biggest toes on both feet tend to stretch the limit. So, I ordered a size 8 in these...and I was worried, because most reviews said that these run long, and to order your regular size. But after receiving them today, I am very happy that I opted for a half size bigger (which seems to be the best for sandals). They are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals in April of 2018. I live in Pennsylvania. I wore them for half of the summer of 2018. These sandals were promised to be high quality and for hiking purposes. However, they wore off very quickly. They are not exactly cheap sandals, and this poor quality is disappointing. On top of wearing quickly, they started to smell. I am not one of those people who has smelly feet. But this material is prone to developing a bad smell over time. Again, that is not what I expected after I paid $50 for my sandals. I would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent comfy walking shoes out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the reviews and they deliver comfort right out of the box! I bought my normal size and they fit perfectly and the adjustable straps are in the correct places and don't hang loose or flap in the breeze like another pair from a different company. These also have a finger loop on the back to pull them off and they are completely washable with very rugged treads on the sole. I had no problem walking down hill on slippery wet grass! I bought the burgundy ones on sale and am delighted the color is very flattering and works with everything after all.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Mcmullin

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are from hell....
customer_reviews.text: I went to Disneyland and after walking a few hours on these, my feet were tender and red. I pushed through the day, then look under my feet to see painful blisters develop where my arches were. I think the material on the soles are too rubbery and soft, and kept creating friction under my feet. These shoes were seriously the worst thing ever. I have worn Tevas before but I've had Old Navy $2 flip flops more comfortable than these. Best to pass on this item...
customer_reviews.author: Sruti Gurunath

customer_reviews.title: kind of like these
customer_reviews.text: I thought i would LOVE these shoes. I often struggle to find adjustable shoes that will tighten enough for my super narrow feet. I found that one shoe fits perfectly while the straps on the other are a little too long. I can make due with the shoes i have, but i am afraid if they stretch out at all i won't be able to tighten them to fit my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Best sandals for everything
customer_reviews.text: I had a black pair of these that I wore all over Costa Rica and now all over Ca. Water dirt, rocks - all terrain. Just got a cute new pair in a brown / tan color. Awesome fit, good flexibility, weight, and thickness of sole. Just there right amount of stap to hold sandal solidly in place. AND they look really cute on your feet!! Pretty close to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Teva is the brand I keep coming back to!
customer_reviews.text: I like these sandals. The footbed really conforms to your foot & has good arch support making them comfortable to wear for a longer time. The straps are a little sharp & could be softer. Other Teva sandals I have do have some cushion on the straps so they don't rub the foot. Don't think I would be wearing these for hours of walking due to the straps. I do like the deep teal color. Teva is a brand I keep coming back to as I have 3 pairs of their sandals at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: WH

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed with these shoes. They run very big so I ordered a whole size down. Even then, along with the 2 adjustable straps, my feet kept falling out. If you're thinking about hiking up an incline, forget it. I didn't last more than 20 minutes before I changed over to my $3 flip flops which ended up being 100x better. Not only that, the glue holding the straps on both sides is already falling apart. After one day of wear! I can't believe I spent $70 on such poorly made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a few pair of tevas and these are ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a few pair of tevas and these are extremely narrow. the metal loop by the little toe rubs even with a tab behind it. it hurts and its not tight. My mom who has a narrow foot and wears narrow shoes cant wear them either hurts her little toe also.
customer_reviews.author: D. Noyes

customer_reviews.title: A little big, big comfy
customer_reviews.text: I tried on my usual size in an actual store (I know, right?) and it seemed as though my toes may creep over the edge at any moment. As the store didn’t have anything half or whole size larger, I ordered on amazon (half size up). It’s borderlibe too big, though it doesn’t really impede the way I can move in the sandals - I just don’t like the aesthetic. That said, the shoes are comfortable and exactly what I wanted for sandals that move around playing tag with your kids. Flip flops aren’t so good at that. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Not for long distance
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are very cute and pretty comfortable right off the bat but no matter how much I try to break them in, they cause blisters. I think the straps are just too thin and badly placed. I bought these for Disney World and despite breaking them in for a month I had multiple blisters by the end of the first day. Pretty disappointing. I will continue to wear them out and about but I’ll need to find a new sandal before I do anymore traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals. I have never bought shoes online because I feared they wouldn't fit, and I would have to keep exchanging them. But, these fit perfectly, they are true to size! The sandals are also elegant and very comfortable from the get go. I walk several miles a day, and I had no issues with them at all. Very pretty and a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mali Nic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combination of refined and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I've had Teva sandals before, and they lasted many miles walked before finally breaking. It's winter, so I haven't had the chance to really get to know this pair. Based on my walks around the house, though, they are the perfect balance of refined and supportive. I wanted something in between Teva's classic sandals (too bulky for my tiny feet) and their really strappy ones (think Kayenta), and these fit the bill perfectly. I love the thicker ankle strap combined with the strappy front. I know I'll get a lot of use out of these come summer--farmer's market days, walking/biking to work, camp shoes, they're even nice enough looking to wear with sundresses for cookouts.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Charron

customer_reviews.title: Just ok - Damaged after short term use
customer_reviews.text: These arrived on time and looked as pictured. They did rub my feet a bit until they were broken in and the back strap is starting to come unglued after limited use. Maybe better to buy from Tevas site. I was excited for these as I had heard great things about Tevas but overall I was not impressed with the quality. They didn't even last 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: SN331

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sandal
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be great sandals. I got them a few days before a trip to Florida, so I did not have a chance to break them in at home, especially since it was only 6° here at that time! I wore them for several days in Florida and had no issues with blisters. I like the fact that they can get wet and you don’t have to route worry about ruining the soles or the straps. Sizing was correct. There are adjustable straps across the toe area and the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: LEH

customer_reviews.title: a little long
customer_reviews.text: I wear 8.5 in sneakers. I bought 8. They are perfect. They do run long. So go down half a size. These are AWESOME> I will live in them from now until october. The thin neoprene on the heal and all other pressure points is absolutely perfect. Not hot, but prevents any rubbing. The perfect shoe. They look great for an amusement park or about town. Feels like a sneaker. Arch support is not too high or annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rodney Clements

customer_reviews.title: So happy with my Tevas
customer_reviews.text: I have wore Tevas for many years! I have had 4 back surgeries and one knee surgery and I can walk in these shoes for miles! They are comfortable and the support is wonderful! They look cute and I wear them everywhere! I totally recommend them!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheilababy

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but wow is this added heel loop dumb.
customer_reviews.text: These are almost perfect, but that loop sticking out of the back is a super-dumb addition for a sandal that is literally composed of straps. What Teva, you thought there's nothing on these that'll let you dangle them from a backpack, so you had to a loop? Fire the designer that came up with that idea immediately, they are doing you no favors. I'll cut off those goofy loops. These are otherwise comfortable and fit like a glove (a glove made of straps) in a 9 for a person who normally wears 9 - 9.5 wide shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CynBio

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in this sandal
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this sandal. I really wanted the Teva Noeta, but it is no longer available. The Noeta had the best arch support, but the Verra doesn't, and the straps don't cover enough of the foot., which I would think helps with support. Too, the foot bed seems to be of a lesser quality.I hope Teva brings back the Noeta, which is a much better sandal. Yes, I returned the Verra.
customer_reviews.author: snicklefritz

customer_reviews.title: Versatile sandals, great for travel
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are comfortable, work with multiple activities and outfits, and are easy to clean. I followed the advice of an earlier reviewer and chose the Bungee Cord grayish color. The sandals held up to hiking in Hawaii, strolls over river rocks, bobbing around in salt water, a grueling three-day Midwestern road trip, and they still look like new. Even the famous Hawaiian red mud washed right off; they looked nice the night after our Hawaiian waterfall hike with a long black dress for a dinner out in Waikiki. I usually wear only Birkenstocks, but these were recommended for long travel days. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short velcro strap makes for fast return
customer_reviews.text: Returned because the ankle strap barely makes it to the velcro strip to close. Not enough space left on the velcro strip for my comfort. I would have to pull it too tight and risk cutting into my feet. I LOVED the color of these Tevas. I had a different style in this color and they don't make it in that color any more, so I bought this one instead. They felt comfortable on my feet. If the strap had fit better, I would have kept them. (I purchased another pair similar to my old kind, in a different color, and they did not have the short velcro strip issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: It's the fit, as usual.
customer_reviews.text: Just another pair of sandals that don't fit. Also, the soul is kind of stiff and the straps, despite adjustability, don't seem long enough, leaving too much velcro exposed. My feet are on the wide side, with a high instep, and toes that are apparently too short for most sandals. That means there is way too much space to trip over at the shoe's front. Buying a smaller size doesn't work, because of the aforementioned width problem. Mostly, three dollar flip-flops fit better than good sandals, to my exasperation.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get these sandals. They were very comfortable on my feet and I initially loved them. I ordered these on April 9 and have only worn them a handful of times and the straps are already breaking away from the sides on both sandals on both sides. It’s April 24, not even 20 days. Very disappointing given the cost.
customer_reviews.author: GGM

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but get smaller size
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite wet sandals that I have found so far! I wear them to water parks, to the beach, all day to theme parks, etc. and they are extremely comfortable. They are light and don't weigh me down. They seem to dry pretty fast as well. They do run big, so definitely size down. I normally wear size 7 in sandals and the 6.5 are the best for me.
customer_reviews.author: hkf

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe but the sizes are WEIRD
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe but the sizes are WEIRD. I am an 8.5 in shoes but I am a 7.5 in these shoes! I brought down a star just because you really need to order a few and try them on. That being said, this is a GREAT shoe if you have wide feet and high arches. I can walk all day in these shoes and be ready to go for more the next morning. the straps stay on and your foot does not slide. I hiked for hours and waded through water and they still look great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as most Teva styles
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Teva's. I have several pair and wanted a new, less worn pair, so ordered these. They look good. They don't have the base support or top support that I'd like, so won't be ordering this style again. These don't hold up to hiking or rock climbing like other styles. I really do like the three strap version, and the older thick strap version.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: My go-to summer sandals!
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly and I didn't have any break-in period, sore spots or blisters. I normally wear a 9.5 (occasionally a 10 in athletic shoes) and the 9.5 fits my foot great. One of my feet is bigger than the other but unlike with some other shoes this has been a non-issue because of the adjustable straps. The Bungee Cord color is wear-with-everything and I've been wearing these a lot because they were immediately comfortable. I think these will be the sandals I live in this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Tosa_Lori

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and the comfort
customer_reviews.text: The footbed of this sandal is very comfortable--just the right amount of cushion and support. The first couple of times that I wore these out and about, the top strap on the right foot rubbed a blister on my toe, but that's probably more due to my foot issues than the shoe. My only complaint is that the velcro on the top strap does not cover enough of the strap, so what is left over just curls and sticks up.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cloth bottom on my Teva Sandals?
customer_reviews.text: I just received these, and it is absurd that these would be described these as having a "spider rubber outsole" when they have covered part of the bottom with a felt-like cloth and there is no mention of it. The reason manufacturers do this is to save on tariffs. I get it, but I would rather pay the higher fee for quality sandals than risk wearing these with cloth on the bottom. They are cheaply made in comparison to my other Teva sandals and feel unsafe as I slip around on the floor. So much for traction and durability. I am so disappointed and view it as false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: WndrLys

customer_reviews.title: although I could not get the arch to hit comfortably in one foot
customer_reviews.text: Awkward sandals. Returned because they just looked ugly with all the spare gray sole sticking out around your foot. Semi-adjustable, although I could not get the arch to hit comfortably in one foot. The sole felt weird, and could have been comfortable if I had made it fit better; mostly, I felt like I had flappy hobbit feet. Would probably still work for going in and out of water and in the sand, which is what I wanted- but I can't see myself using these as tourist or go-to sandals. Still looking for a good Teva sandal (or equivalent) that is either cuter, or not $100.
customer_reviews.author: OntheGo

customer_reviews.title: They were great! I wore them almost everyday while I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a trip to Hawaii. They were great! I wore them almost everyday while I was there and the days I didn't I regretted it! I am typically a size 6.5 in tennis shoes and after doing some research I decided to order the size 6. It was a perfect fit. I love how easy and quick they are to adjust if your feet swell or move around in the shoe. I wore these shoes everywhere. Hiking, swimming, walking, with dresses, pants, and shorts. All around a great shoe that I still wear all the time now that I am home. Thank you Teva!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear to Disney World because I had heard such great things about how well they hold up to hiking and serious walking and I am totally convinced they're worth it. It's hard to believe the straps can be so comfortable but they are. I knocked one star off because the toe strap sticks up at the end because I have to pull it so tight that it runs out of velcro but I have a very narrow foot and it's only a cosmetic annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Tara H.

customer_reviews.title: These are all you need! No, Really!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only show you will ever need! I wish I would have known about these years earlier, and not had to find them by coincident. If you are looking for a comfortable shoe that can get wet, dry quickly, but that is not even the best feature. If you need a shoe to go around the world and back again, I'm telling you, this is it. Don't even bother packing anything else. I am amazed. I know it sounds like I'm going overboard, but I am so excited about this purchase. You just never know when you order online, but this is probably my greatest find EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kriss Blume

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals for great price
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my Teva's! I contemplated between these and chacos, and am happy I went with these ones. I borrowed a friends chacos first and found that they were really hard to adjust. After I got it adjusted, I felt very claustrophobic in them. The sole was also very heavy. So then I bought these Teva's and they were almost exactly opposite! The shoe itself is a good weight. The straps are very easy to adjust, but also stays in place really well (strong velcro). I feels comfortable on my feet and I've enjoyed taking in out camping and such. I was also able to get this at a great price, whereas chacos are on the pricey side. Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kokoro

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely awesome! You don't even realize you have them on! I like them so much I ordered every color! I have received many many compliments! Treat yourself! You will not be sorry and your feet will thank you! I walked for eight hours in these the first day right out the box! They are by far the comfortable shoe ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Caution to those with a very high instep
customer_reviews.text: Hello, if you have a very high instep/arch, the straps across the ankle might not be long enough. That was the case for me and I had to return so, I never actually got to wear them. However, they seemed workable for me otherwise. There is a little bit of cushion under the triangle connector over the pinkie toe area, so I assume that wouldn't bind into your toe.
customer_reviews.author: Al Barron

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Sandals!
customer_reviews.text: By far, best purchase of the year. The sandals look just like the picture, they are true to size and super comfortable!!. I love the fact that you can adjust them to your feet width, especially if you have narrow feet like me!. UPDATE: I gave this sandals a 5 star review. I'm changing it to 3 now because I have only used them for a good 8 times and haven't walked them that much and the strips are already detaching from the rubber sole. I'm very disappointed since the sandals are true to size and fit great on my narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: DEAC

customer_reviews.title: A dozen seems ready to cause a blister
customer_reviews.text: I have worn teva sandals for at least 20 years. These aren’t as cute to wear with a sundress as others have been but previous styles aren’t available. These have a dozen seems and each one is a pressure point. I have 6 blisters on each foot, all corresponding to a week. His is after just three miles. I can’t wear them.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: The fit was great, and they were comfortable - for the most part. However the top toe straps are not completely lined with felt and I got horrendeous blisters. Secondly, even though I would put up with this normally (my feet just blister easily - all the time), these went on ONE weekend trip and are beginning to fall apart. Not sure if this was a defective pair, but very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: AT

product_meta.title: Teva Women's Verra Sandal
product_meta.description: Teva is an authentic icon in the outdoor industry. Founded in the early 1980's by a Colorado River guide, Teva pioneered the sport-sandal category. For more than 20 years on rivers, in canyons, and across the trails of the great outdoors, athletes and enthusiasts have traveled the globe comfortably and confidently in Teva footwear. Providing positive contributions to the world in which we play is at the core of everything Teva stands for. The Teva name itself is a Hebrew word meaning "nature" and the hand logo is the Hopi symbol for "friendship" and "water." Teva supports the outdoor athletic lifestyle and remains committed to innovation in outdoor performance footwear, the platforms which carry enthusiasts beyond the offices of the day-to-day and onto the rivers, trails, and canyons of the next adventure.
feature_bullets: Water-ready sandal featuring two hook-and-loop for adjustability and heel pull-on loop
Shock-absorbing ShocPad technology, Microban zinc-based odor-resistant treatment
Contoured EVA footbed supports your arch to keep your foot happy and healthy
Spider Rubber outsole for traction and durability
